alert.note: Alert for Le Flore (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued January 13 at 1:09PM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON SUNDAY TO NOON CST MONDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Arkansas and southeast Oklahoma. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Warning, from noon Sunday to noon CST Monday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Sunday afternoon through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. In Arkansas, for the latest road conditions call 1-800-245- 1672 or go to idrivearkansas.com. In Oklahoma, for the latest road conditions call 1-844-465-4997 or go to okRoads.org.
